oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: WHN Guest Disc Jockey - Dave and Sugar - 1978-09-18
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is from Dave and Sugar's (musical group) performance as disc jockey for WHN Studios. The performance was on September 18, 1978. The tape was created by the WHN radio network.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Dave and Sugar
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Unidentified intro jingle [featuring unidentified voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (00:09) Dave Rowland, Sue Powell and Vicki Baker introduce Olivia Newton John -- (00:17) Hopeless Devoted to You (Olivia Newton John) -- (03:09) Rowland, Powell, and Baker joke about Grease -- (04:21) Don't Throw it All Away (Dave and Sugar) -- (07:28) Rowland, Powell, and Baker perform a Dr. Pepper radio spot -- (07:48) Toyota jingle [featuring Rowland voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (09:00) Simmon's commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (10:00) Rowland and Baker reflect on the success of "Tear Time" -- (11:01) Tear Time (Dave and Sugar) -- (13:29) Powell performs a weather commercial break, and Rowland reflects on Dave and Sugar's first number one release -- (14:35) The Door is Always Open (Dave and Sugar) -- (17:18) How Many Lovely Evenings [unconfirmed] ([Unidentified]) -- (20:07) Baker performs a WHN radio spot, and Rowland reveals that Dave and Sugar will be in town for a little while -- (21:35) Baker reveals Steve Wariner is going to open up for Dave and Sugar -- (21:56) I'm Gonna Love You (Dave and Sugar) -- (24:42) Rowland, Powell, and Baker discuss a story about a plane change -- (27:22) When I Stop Leavin' (I'll be Gone) (Charley Pride) -- (29:52) Rowland reflects on growing up, singing, in Sanger, California; additionally, Baker reflects on moving multiple times in her life -- (31:54) Powell reflects on growing up as a singer -- (32:42) I'm Knee Deep in Lovin' You (Dave and Sugar) -- (35:12) In Love [Unconfirmed] (Dave and Sugar) -- (37:38) Baker performs a weather radio spot -- (38:00) Corvette commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (38:31) Extra Strength Sineoff commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (39:02) Unidentified host interviews Tim and Francis Ruler (unconfirmed) about their ice cream shop -- (39:58) Powell performs a Dave and Sugar radio spot -- (40:31) Rowland reflects on "That's the Way Love Should be" -- (40:52) That's the Way Love Should be (Dave and Sugar) -- (43:00) Rowland, Powell, and Baker performs a radio spot, and Rowland reveals that he worked on a show with Elvis Presley -- (46:53) Gotta Quit Lookin' at You Baby (Dave and Sugar) -- (48:52) Rowland discusses his appreciation for the Country Music Award Show -- (49:34) Baker, Powell, and an unidentified host discuss the advancements of Camp David -- (51:55) Susan Dempsey discusses upcoming local events -- (52:35) Rowland, Powell, and Baker reintroduce themselves, and Rowland reflects on the upcoming National Anthem they are about to perform -- (53:24) Hello Mexico (And Adios Baby to You) (Johnny Duncan) -- (56:14) Rowland, Powell, and Baker give their thanks, and all say their goodbyes
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Dave & Sugar; Dave and Sugar;
